schemas.name: sample_registration
schemas.description: The collection of data elements required to register the required Donor-Specimen-Sample data to the ARGO Data Platform. Registration of samples is required before molecular and clinical data submission can proceed.

fields.name: program_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the ARGO program.

meta.notes: This is the unique id that is assigned to your program.  If you have logged into the platform, this is the Program Id that you see in the Program Services area. For example, TEST-CA is a Program ID.

fields.name: submitter_donor_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the donor, assigned by the data provider.

fields.name: gender
fields.description: Description of the donor self-reported gender. Gender is described as the assemblage of properties that distinguish people on the basis of their societal roles.

fields.name: submitter_specimen_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the specimen, assigned by the data provider.

fields.name: specimen_tissue_source
fields.description: Tissue source of the biospecimen.

fields.name: tumour_normal_designation
fields.description: Description of specimens tumour/normal status for data processing.

fields.name: specimen_type
fields.description: Description of the kind of specimen that was collected with respect to tumour/normal tissue origin.

codeList: Cell line - derived from metastatic tumour
Cell line - derived from xenograft tumour
Metastatic tumour - metastasis local to lymph node
Metastatic tumour - metastasis to distant location
Normal - tissue adjacent to primary tumour
Tumour - unknown if derived from primary or metastatic
Xenograft - derived from tumour cell line

fields.name: submitter_sample_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the sample, assigned by the data provider.

fields.name: sample_type
fields.description: Description of the type of molecular sample used for testing.

schemas.name: donor
schemas.description: The collection of data elements related to a specific donor in an ARGO program.

fields.name: program_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the ARGO program.
Unique identifier of the donor, assigned by the data provider.
fields.name: submitter_donor_id

fields.description: Donor's last known state of living or deceased.
fields.name: vital_status

fields.description: Indicate the cause of a donor's death.
fields.name: cause_of_death

meta.notes: Cause of death is only required to be submitted if the donor's vital_status is Deceased.

fields.description: Interval of how long the donor has survived since primary diagnosis, in days.
fields.name: survival_time

meta.notes: Survival_time is only required to be submitted if the donor's vital_status is Deceased.

fields.name: primary_site
fields.description: The text term used to describe the primary site of disease, as categorized by the World Health Organization's (WHO) International Classification of Diseases for Oncology (ICD-O). This categorization groups cases into general categories.

meta.notes: To include multiple values, separate values with a pipe delimiter '|' within your file.

codeList: Bones, joints and articular cartilage of limbs
Bones, joints and articular cartilage of other and unspecified sites
Connective, subcutaneous and other soft tissues
Other and ill-defined sites in lip, oral cavity and pharynx
Other and ill-defined sites within respiratory system and intrathoracic organs
Other and unspecified female genital organs
Other and unspecified major salivary glands
Other and unspecified male genital organs
Other and unspecified parts of biliary tract
Other and unspecified parts of mouth
Other and unspecified parts of tongue
Other endocrine glands and related structures
Peripheral nerves and autonomic nervous system
Spinal cord, cranial nerves, and other parts of central nervous system

fields.description: Indicate the donor's height, in centimeters (cm).
fields.name: height

fields.description: Indicate the donor's weight, in kilograms (kg).
fields.name: weight

fields.description: Indicate the donor's Body Mass Index (BMI) in kg/m².
fields.name: bmi

fields.description: Indicate presence of any hereditary genetic disorders. Genetic diseases are diseases in which inherited genes predispose to increased risk. The genetic disorders associated with cancer often result from an alteration or mutation in a single gene. The diseases range from rare dominant cancer family syndrome to familial tendencies in which low-penetrance genes may interact with other genes or environmental factors to induce cancer. (References: NCIt C3101. Genetic disorder names were standardized using Orphanet (https://www.orpha.net/) and NCI Thesaurus)
fields.name: genetic_disorders

codeList: Familial Atypical Multiple Mole Melanoma Syndrome (FAMMM)
Hereditary Breast and Ovarian Cancer Syndrome (HBOC)
Hereditary Leiomyomatosis and Renal Cell Cancer (HLRCC)

meta.notes: If the genetic disorder term you use is not included in the controlled terminology, please contact us at https://platform.icgc-argo.org/contact to request it be added. To include multiple values, separate values with a pipe delimiter '|' within your file.

fields.description: Indicate the donor's menopause status at the time of primary diagnosis. (Reference: caDSR CDE ID 2434914)
fields.name: menopause_status

fields.description: Indicate the donor's age, in years, at which the first menstruation event occurred. (Reference: NCIt C19666)
fields.name: age_at_menarche

fields.description: Indicate the total number of pregnancy events experienced by the donor. (Reference: NCIt C106551)
fields.name: number_of_pregnancies

fields.description: Indicate the number of children the donor has birthed. (Reference: caDSR CDE ID 2486644)
fields.name: number_of_children

fields.description: Indicate the type of hormone replacement therapy (HRT) the donor has taken or is currently taking.
fields.name: hrt_type

fields.description: If donor has taken hormone replacement therapy (HRT), indicate how long donor has been taking HRT, in months. (Reference: caDSR CDE ID 5365433)
fields.name: hrt_duration

fields.description: Indicate the type of hormonal contraception the donor has taken or is currently taking. (Reference: caDSR CDE ID 3264234)
fields.name: contraception_type

fields.description: If donor has taken hormonal contraception, indicate duration of use, in months. (Reference: caDSR CDE ID 5206887)
fields.name: contraception_duration

fields.description: If the donor became lost to follow up, indicate the identifier of the clinical event (eg. submitter_primary_diagnosis_id, submitter_treatment_id or submitter_follow_up_id) after which the donor became lost to follow up.
fields.name: lost_to_followup_after_clinical_event_id

meta.displayName: Lost To Follow Up After Clinical Event

schemas.name: specimen
schemas.description: The collection of data elements related to a donor's specimen. A specimen is any material sample taken for testing, diagnostic or research purposes.

fields.name: program_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the ARGO program.

fields.name: submitter_donor_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the donor, assigned by the data provider.

fields.name: submitter_specimen_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the specimen, assigned by the data provider.

fields.name: submitter_primary_diagnosis_id
fields.description: Indicate the primary diagnosis event in the clinical timeline that this specimen acquisition was related to.

fields.name: pathological_tumour_staging_system
fields.description: Specify the tumour staging system used to assess the cancer at the time the tumour specimen was resected. Pathological classification is based on the clinical stage information (acquired before treatment) and supplemented/modified by operative findings and pathological evaluation of the resected specimen.

meta.notes: This field is only required if the specimen is a tumour.

fields.name: pathological_t_category
fields.description: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined by the size or contiguous extension of the primary tumour (T), according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

meta.notes: This field is required only if the selected pathological_tumour_staging_system is any edition of the AJCC cancer staging system.

fields.name: pathological_n_category
fields.description: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined by whether or not the cancer has reached nearby lymph nodes (N), according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

meta.notes: This field is required only if the selected pathological_tumour_staging_system is any edition of the AJCC cancer staging system.

fields.name: pathological_m_category
fields.description: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined by whether there are distant metastases (M), meaning spread of cancer to other parts of the body, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

meta.notes: This field is required only if the selected pathological_tumour_staging_system is any edition of the AJCC cancer staging system.

fields.name: pathological_stage_group
fields.description: Specify the tumour stage, based on pathological_tumour_staging_system, used to assess the cancer at the time the tumour specimen was resected.

meta.notes:
This field depends on the selected pathological_tumour_staging_system, and is only required if the specimen is a tumour.
Please refer to the documentation for Tumour Staging Classifications: http://docs.icgc-argo.org/docs/submission/dictionary-overview#tumour-staging-classifications

fields.name: specimen_acquisition_interval
fields.description: Interval between primary diagnosis and specimen acquisition, in days.

meta.notes: The associated primary diagnosis is used as the reference point for this interval. To calculate this, find the number of days since the date of primary diagnosis.

fields.name: tumour_histological_type
fields.description: The code to represent the histology (morphology) of neoplasms that is usually obtained from a pathology report, according to the International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, 3rd Edition (WHO ICD-O-3). Refer to the ICD-O-3 manual for guidelines at https://apps.who.int/iris/handle/10665/42344.

meta.notes: This field is only required if the specimen is a tumour.

fields.name: specimen_anatomic_location
fields.description: Indicate the ICD-O-3 topography code for the anatomic location of a specimen when it was collected. Refer to the guidelines provided in the ICD-O-3 manual at https://apps.who.int/iris/handle/10665/42344.

fields.name: specimen_laterality
fields.description: For cancer in a paired organ, indicate the side on which the specimen was obtained. (Reference caDSR CDE ID 2007875)

fields.name: specimen_processing
fields.description: Indicate the technique used to process specimen.

codeList: Cryopreservation of live cells in liquid nitrogen

fields.name: specimen_storage
fields.description: Indicate the method of specimen storage for specimen that were not extracted freshly or immediately cultured.

meta.notes: For specimens that were freshly extracted or immediately cultured, select Not Applicable.

fields.name: reference_pathology_confirmed
fields.description: Indicate whether the pathological diagnosis was confirmed by a (central) reference pathologist. (Reference caDSR CDE ID 2007007)

meta.notes: This field is only required if the specimen is a tumour.

fields.name: tumour_grading_system
fields.description: Specify the tumour staging system used to assess the description of a tumour based on how abnormal the tumour cells and the tumour tissue look under a microscope. Tumour grade is an indicator of how quickly a tumour is likely to grow.

meta.notes: This field is only required if the specimen is a tumour.

codeList: WHO grading system for CNS tumours

fields.name: tumour_grade
fields.description: Grade of the tumour as assigned by the reporting tumour_grading_system.

meta.notes:
This field depends on the selected tumour_grading_system, and is only required if the specimen is a tumour.
Please refer to the documentation for Tumour Grading Classifications: http://docs.icgc-argo.org/docs/submission/dictionary-overview#tumour-grading-classifications

fields.name: percent_tumour_cells
fields.description: Indicate a value, in decimals, that represents the percent of tumour cells compared to the number of total cells in a specimen. (Reference: NCIt: C159484)

meta.notes: This field is only required if the specimen is a tumour.

fields.name: percent_tumour_cells_measurement_method
fields.description: Indicate method used to measure percent_tumour_cells.

meta.notes: This field is only required if the specimen is a tumour.

fields.name: percent_proliferating_cells
fields.description: Indicate a value, in decimals, that represents the count of proliferating cells determined during pathologic review of the specimen.

meta.notes: This field should only be submitted if the specimen is tumour.

fields.name: percent_inflammatory_tissue
fields.description: Indicate a value, in decimals, that represents the percent of a specimen that is positive for inflammatory markers, including the presence of capillary dilatation, edema and increased leukocytes. (Reference NCIt C159479)

meta.notes: This field should only be submitted if the specimen is tumour.

fields.name: percent_stromal_cells
fields.description: Indicate a value, in decimals, that represents the percentage of reactive cells that are present in a tumour specimen but are not malignant such as fibroblasts, vascular structures, etc. (Reference caDSR CDE ID 2841241)

meta.notes: This field should only be submitted if the specimen is tumour.

fields.name: percent_necrosis
fields.description: Indicate a value, in decimals, that represents the percent of cells undergoing necrosis compared to the number of total cells present in a tumour specimen. (Reference NCIt C159481)

meta.notes: This field should only be submitted if the specimen is tumour.

schemas.name: primary_diagnosis
schemas.description: The collection of data elements related to a donor's primary diagnosis. The primary diagnosis is the first diagnosed case of cancer in a donor. To submit multiple primary diagnoses for a single donor, submit multiple rows in the primary diagnosis file for this donor.

fields.name: program_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the ARGO program.

fields.name: submitter_donor_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the donor, assigned by the data provider.

fields.name: submitter_primary_diagnosis_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the primary diagnosis event, assigned by the data provider.

fields.name: age_at_diagnosis
fields.description: Age that the donor was first diagnosed with cancer, in years. This should be based on the earliest diagnosis of cancer.

fields.name: cancer_type_code
fields.description: The code to represent the cancer type using the WHO ICD-10 code (https://icd.who.int/browse10/2019/en) classification.

fields.name: cancer_type_additional_information
fields.description: Additional details related to the cancer type that are not covered by the ICD-10 code provided in the cancer_type field.

fields.name: basis_of_diagnosis
fields.description: Indicate the most valid basis of how the primary diagnosis was identified. If more than one diagnosis technique was used, select the term that has the highest code number (see notes). (Reference: IACR Standard for Basis of Diagnosis http://www.iacr.com.fr/images/doc/basis.pdf)

meta.notes:
0: Death certificate only: Information provided is from a death certificate.
1: Clinical: Diagnosis made before death.
2: Clinical investigation: All diagnostic techniques, including X-ray, endoscopy, imaging, ultrasound, exploratory surgery (such as laparotomy), and autopsy, without a tissue diagnosis.
4: Specific tumour markers: Including biochemical and/or immunologic markers that are specific for a tumour site.
5: Cytology: Examination of cells from a primary or secondary site, including fluids aspirated by endoscopy or needle; also includes the microscopic examination of peripheral blood and bone marrow aspirates.
6: Histology of a metastasis: Histologic examination of tissue from a metastasis, including autopsy specimens.
7: Histology of a primary tumour: Histologic examination of tissue from primary tumour, however obtained, including all cutting techniques and bone marrow biopsies; also includes autopsy specimens of primary tumour.
9: Unknown: No information on how the diagnosis has been made.

fields.name: laterality
fields.description: For cancer in a paired organ, indicate the side of the body on which the primary tumour or cancer first developed at the time of primary diagnosis. (Reference caDSR CDE ID 827)

fields.name: lymph_nodes_examined_status
fields.description: Indicate if lymph nodes were examined for metastases.

codeList: No lymph nodes found in resected specimen

fields.name: lymph_nodes_examined_method
fields.description: Indicate the method used to examine lymph nodes.

meta.displayName: Method Used to Examine Lymph Nodes

fields.name: number_lymph_nodes_examined
fields.description: The total number of lymph nodes tested for the presence of cancer. (Reference: caDSR CDE ID 3)

meta.notes: This field should only be submitted if 'lymph_nodes_examined_status' is 'Yes'.

fields.name: number_lymph_nodes_positive
fields.description: The number of regional lymph nodes reported as being positive for tumour metastases. (Reference: caDSR CDE ID 6113694)

meta.notes: This field is only required if 'lymph_nodes_examined_status' is 'Yes'.

fields.name: clinical_tumour_staging_system
fields.description: Indicate the tumour staging system used to stage the cancer at the time of primary diagnosis (prior to treatment).

fields.name: clinical_t_category
fields.description: The code to represent the extent of the primary tumour (T) based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined at time of primary diagnosis and prior to treatment, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

meta.notes: This field is required only if the selected clinical_tumour_staging_system is any edition of the AJCC cancer staging system.

fields.name: clinical_n_category
fields.description: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined by the extent of the regional lymph node (N) involvement for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined at time of primary diagnosis and prior to treatment, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

meta.notes: This field is required only if the selected clinical_tumour_staging_system is any edition of the AJCC cancer staging system.

fields.name: clinical_m_category
fields.description: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined by the extent of the distant metastasis (M) for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined at time of primary diagnosis and prior to treatment, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual. MX is NOT a valid category and cannot be assigned.

meta.notes: This field is required only if the selected clinical_tumour_staging_system is any edition of the AJCC cancer staging system.

fields.name: clinical_stage_group
fields.description: Stage group of the tumour, as assigned by the reporting clinical_tumour_staging_system, that indicates the overall prognostic tumour stage.

meta.notes:
This field is dependent on the selected clinical_tumour_staging_system.
Please refer to the documentation for Tumour Staging Classifications: http://docs.icgc-argo.org/docs/submission/dictionary-overview#tumour-staging-classifications

fields.name: presenting_symptoms
fields.description: Indicate presenting symptoms at time of primary diagnosis.

meta.notes: To include multiple values, separate values with a pipe delimiter '|' within your file.

fields.name: performance_status
fields.description: Indicate the donor's performance status grade at the time of primary diagnosis. (Reference: ECOG performance score grades from https://ecog-acrin.org/resources/ecog-performance-status).

meta.notes:
Grade 0: Fully active, able to carry on all pre-disease performance without restriction.
Grade 1: Restricted in physically strenuous activity but ambulatory and able to carry out work of a light or sedentary nature (ie. Light house work, office work).
Grade 2: Ambulatory and capable of all selfcare but unable to carry out any work activities; up and about more than 50% of waking hours.
Grade 3: Capable of only limited selfcare; confined to bed or chair more than 50% of waking hours.
Grade 4: Completely disabled; cannot carry on any selfcare; totally confined to bed or chair

schemas.name: treatment
schemas.description: The collection of data elements related to a donor's treatment at a specific point in the clinical record. To submit multiple treatments for a single donor, please submit treatment rows in the treatment file for this donor.

fields.name: program_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the ARGO program.

fields.name: submitter_donor_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the donor, assigned by the data provider.

fields.name: submitter_treatment_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the treatment, assigned by the data provider.

fields.name: submitter_primary_diagnosis_id
fields.description: Indicate the primary diagnosis event in the clinical timeline that this treatment was related to.

fields.name: treatment_type
fields.description: Indicate the type of treatment regimen that the donor completed.

meta.notes:
Depending on the treatment_type(s) selected, additional treatment details may be required to be submitted. For example, if treatment_type includes 'Chemotherapy', the supplemental Chemotherapy treatment type file is required.
To include multiple values, separate values with a pipe delimiter '|' within your file.

fields.name: is_primary_treatment
fields.description: Indicate if the treatment was the primary treatment following the initial diagnosis.

fields.name: line_of_treatment
fields.description: Indicate the line of treatment if it is not the primary treatment.

fields.name: treatment_start_interval
fields.description: The interval between the primary diagnosis and initiation of treatment, in days.

meta.notes: The associated primary diagnosis is used as the reference point for this interval. To calculate this, find the number of days since the date of primary diagnosis.

fields.name: treatment_duration
fields.description: The duration of treatment regimen, in days.

fields.name: days_per_cycle
fields.description: Indicate the number of days in a treatment cycle.

fields.name: number_of_cycles
fields.description: Indicate the number of treatment cycles.

fields.name: treatment_intent
fields.description: Indicate the purpose of the treatment, or the desired effect or outcome resulting from the treatment. (Reference: mCODE/FHIR)

fields.name: treatment_setting
fields.description: Indicate the treatment setting, which describes the treatment's purpose in relation to the primary treatment. (Reference: NCIt C124308)

fields.name: response_to_treatment_criteria_method
fields.description: Indicate the criteria used to assess the donor's response to the applied treatment regimen.

codeList: ELN Dohner AML 2017 Oncology Response Criteria
IWG Cheson AML 2003 Oncology Response Criteria

fields.name: response_to_treatment
fields.description: The donor's response to the applied treatment regimen.

codeList: Complete remission with incomplete hematologic recovery (CRi)
Complete remission without minimal residual disease (CRMRD-)
Morphologic complete remission with incomplete blood count recovery (CRi)

meta.notes: This field depends on the selected response_to_treatment_criteria_method. Please refer to the documentation for Response to Treatment Criteria: http://docs.icgc-argo.org/docs/submission/dictionary-overview#response-to-treatment-criteria

fields.name: outcome_of_treatment
fields.description: Indicate the donor's outcome of the prescribed treatment.

codeList: Treatment incomplete due to technical or organizational problems
Treatment stopped due to lack of efficacy (disease progression)
Treatment stopped due to acute toxicity

fields.name: toxicity_type
fields.description: If the treatment was terminated early due to acute toxicity, indicate whether it was due to hematological toxicity or non-hematological toxicity.

fields.name: hematological_toxicity
fields.description: Indicate the hematological toxicities which caused early termination of the treatment. (Codelist reference: NCI-CTCAE (v5.0))

meta.notes: To include multiple values, separate values with a pipe delimiter '|' within your file.

fields.name: non-hematological_toxicity
fields.description: Indicate the non-hematological toxicities which caused early termination of the treatment. (Codelist reference: NCI-CTCAE (v5.0))

meta.notes: To include multiple values, separate values with a pipe delimiter '|' within your file.

fields.name: adverse_events
fields.description: Report any treatment related adverse events. (Codelist reference: NCI-CTCAE (v5.0))

codeList: Blood and lymphatic system disorders - Other, specify
Congenital, familial and genetic disorders - Other, specify
Ear and labyrinth disorders - Other, specify
General disorders and administration site conditions - Other, specify
Injury, poisoning and procedural complications - Other, specify
Joint range of motion decreased cervical spine
Joint range of motion decreased lumbar spine
Metabolism and nutrition disorders - Other, specify
Musculoskeletal and connective tissue disorder - Other, specify
Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps) - Other, specify
Pregnancy, puerperium and perinatal conditions - Other, specify
Renal and urinary disorders - Other, specify
Reproductive system and breast disorders - Other, specify
Respiratory, thoracic and mediastinal disorders - Other, specify
Skin and subcutaneous tissue disorders - Other, specify
Surgical and medical procedures - Other, specify

meta.notes: To include multiple values, separate values with a pipe delimiter '|' within your file.

fields.name: clinical_trials_database
fields.description: If the donor is a participant in a clinical trial, indicate the clinical trial database where the clinical trial is registered.

meta.notes: If the clinical trials database you use is not included in the controlled terminology, please contact us at https://platform.icgc-argo.org/contact to request it be added.

fields.name: clinical_trial_number
fields.description: Based on the clinical_trial_database, indicate the unique NCT or EudraCT clinical trial identifier of which the donor is a participant.

schemas.name: chemotherapy
schemas.description: The collection of data elements describing the details of a chemotherapy treatment regimen completed by a donor. To submit multiple treatment drugs for a single regimen, submit multiple rows in the chemotherapy file.

fields.name: program_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the ARGO program.

fields.name: submitter_donor_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the donor, assigned by the data provider.

fields.name: submitter_treatment_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the treatment, as assigned by the data provider.

fields.name: drug_rxnormcui
fields.description: The unique RxNormID assigned to the treatment regimen drug.

meta.notes:
This field uses standardized vocabulary from the RxNorm database (https://www.nlm.nih.gov/research/umls/rxnorm), provided by the NIH.

You can search for RX Norm values through the web interface (https://mor.nlm.nih.gov/RxNav/) or API (https://mor.nlm.nih.gov/download/rxnav/RxNormAPIs.html).

For example, to find the rxnormcui based on drug name, you can use: https://rxnav.nlm.nih.gov/REST/rxcui.json?name=leucovorin or https://mor.nlm.nih.gov/RxNav/search?searchBy=String&searchTerm=leucovorin

fields.name: drug_name
fields.description: Name of agent or drug administered to donor as part of the treatment regimen.

meta.notes:
This field uses standardized vocabulary from the RxNorm database (https://www.nlm.nih.gov/research/umls/rxnorm), provided by the NIH.

You can search for RX Norm values through the web interface (https://mor.nlm.nih.gov/RxNav/) or API (https://mor.nlm.nih.gov/download/rxnav/RxNormAPIs.html).

For example, to find the rxnormcui based on drug name, you can use: https://rxnav.nlm.nih.gov/REST/rxcui.json?name=leucovorin or https://mor.nlm.nih.gov/RxNav/search?searchBy=String&searchTerm=leucovorin

fields.name: chemotherapy_drug_dose_units
fields.description: Indicate units used to record chemotherapy drug dose.

fields.name: prescribed_cumulative_drug_dose
fields.description: Indicate the total prescribed cumulative drug dose in the same units specified in chemotherapy_drug_dose_units.

meta.notes: Either the 'actual_cumulative_drug_dose' or the 'prescribed_cumulative_drug_dose' field must be submitted.

fields.name: actual_cumulative_drug_dose
fields.description: Indicate the total actual cumulative drug dose in the same units specified in chemotherapy_drug_dose_units.

meta.notes: Either the 'actual_cumulative_drug_dose' or the 'prescribed_cumulative_drug_dose' field must be submitted.

fields.name: dose_intensity_reduction
fields.description: Indicate if there was a significant reduction in dose intensity.

fields.name: dose_intensity_reduction_event
fields.description: If there was a signficiant reduction in dose intensity, indicate which event caused it.

meta.notes: This field should only be submitted if 'dose_intensity_reduction' is 'Yes'

fields.name: dose_intensity_reduction_amount
fields.description: If there was a significant reduction in dose intensity, indicate the amount.

meta.notes: This field should only be submitted if 'dose_intensity_reduction' is 'Yes'

schemas.name: hormone_therapy
schemas.description: The collection of data elements describing the details of a hormone treatment therapy completed by a donor. To submit multiple treatment drugs for a single regimen, submit multiple rows in the hormone_therapy file.

fields.name: program_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the ARGO program.

fields.name: submitter_donor_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the donor, assigned by the data provider.

fields.name: submitter_treatment_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the treatment, assigned by the data provider.

fields.name: drug_rxnormcui
fields.description: The unique RxNormID assigned to the treatment regimen drug.

meta.notes:
This field uses standardized vocabulary from the RxNorm database (https://www.nlm.nih.gov/research/umls/rxnorm), provided by the NIH.

You can search for RX Norm values through the web interface (https://mor.nlm.nih.gov/RxNav/) or API (https://mor.nlm.nih.gov/download/rxnav/RxNormAPIs.html).

For example, to find the rxnormcui based on drug name, you can use: https://rxnav.nlm.nih.gov/REST/rxcui.json?name=leucovorin or https://mor.nlm.nih.gov/RxNav/search?searchBy=String&searchTerm=leucovorin

fields.name: drug_name
fields.description: Name of agent or drug administered to donor as part of the treatment regimen.

meta.notes:
This field uses standardized vocabulary from the RxNorm database (https://www.nlm.nih.gov/research/umls/rxnorm), provided by the NIH.

You can search for RX Norm values through the web interface (https://mor.nlm.nih.gov/RxNav/) or API (https://mor.nlm.nih.gov/download/rxnav/RxNormAPIs.html).

For example, to find the rxnormcui based on drug name, you can use: https://rxnav.nlm.nih.gov/REST/rxcui.json?name=leucovorin or https://mor.nlm.nih.gov/RxNav/search?searchBy=String&searchTerm=leucovorin

fields.name: hormone_drug_dose_units
fields.description: Indicate the units used to record hormone drug dose.

fields.name: prescribed_cumulative_drug_dose
fields.description: Indicate the total prescribed cumulative drug dose in the same units specified in hormone_drug_dose_units.

meta.notes: Either the 'actual_cumulative_drug_dose' or the 'prescribed_cumulative_drug_dose' field must be submitted.

fields.name: actual_cumulative_drug_dose
fields.description: Indicate the total actual cumulative drug dose in the same units specified in hormone_drug_dose_units.

meta.notes: Either the 'actual_cumulative_drug_dose' or the 'prescribed_cumulative_drug_dose' field must be submitted.

schemas.name: radiation
schemas.description: The collection of data elements describing the details of a radiation treatment completed by a donor.

fields.name: program_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the ARGO program.

fields.name: submitter_donor_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the donor, assigned by the data provider.

fields.name: submitter_treatment_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the treatment, assigned by the data provider.

fields.name: radiation_therapy_modality
fields.description: Indicate the method of radiation treatment or modality.

fields.name: radiation_therapy_type
fields.description: Indicate type of radiation therapy administered.

meta.notes: Internal application includes Brachytherapy.

fields.name: radiation_therapy_fractions
fields.description: Indicate the total number of fractions delivered as part of treatment.

fields.name: radiation_therapy_dosage
fields.description: Indicate the total dose given in units of Gray (Gy).

fields.name: anatomical_site_irradiated
fields.description: Indicate body region where radiation therapy was administered. (Reference: Cancer Care Ontario)

schemas.name: immunotherapy
schemas.description: The collection of data elements describing the details of an immunotherapy treatment completed by a donor.

fields.name: program_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the ARGO program.

fields.name: submitter_donor_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the donor, assigned by the data provider.

fields.name: submitter_treatment_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the treatment, assigned by the data provider.

fields.name: immunotherapy_type
fields.description: Indicate the type of immunotherapy administered to donor.

codeList: Monoclonal antibodies other than immune checkpoint inhibitors

fields.name: drug_rxnormcui
fields.description: The unique RxNormID assigned to the treatment regimen drug.

meta.notes:
This field uses standardized vocabulary from the RxNorm database (https://www.nlm.nih.gov/research/umls/rxnorm), provided by the NIH.

You can search for RX Norm values through the web interface (https://mor.nlm.nih.gov/RxNav/) or API (https://mor.nlm.nih.gov/download/rxnav/RxNormAPIs.html).

For example, to find the rxnormcui based on drug name, you can use: https://rxnav.nlm.nih.gov/REST/rxcui.json?name=leucovorin or https://mor.nlm.nih.gov/RxNav/search?searchBy=String&searchTerm=leucovorin

fields.name: drug_name
fields.description: Name of agent or drug administered to donor as part of the treatment regimen.

meta.notes:
This field uses standardized vocabulary from the RxNorm database (https://www.nlm.nih.gov/research/umls/rxnorm), provided by the NIH.

You can search for RX Norm values through the web interface (https://mor.nlm.nih.gov/RxNav/) or API (https://mor.nlm.nih.gov/download/rxnav/RxNormAPIs.html).

For example, to find the rxnormcui based on drug name, you can use: https://rxnav.nlm.nih.gov/REST/rxcui.json?name=leucovorin or https://mor.nlm.nih.gov/RxNav/search?searchBy=String&searchTerm=leucovorin

fields.name: immunotherapy_drug_dose_units
fields.description: Indicate units used to record immunotherapy drug dose.

fields.name: prescribed_cumulative_drug_dose
fields.description: Indicate the total prescribed cumulative drug dose in the same units specified in immunotherapy_drug_dose_units.

meta.notes: Either the 'actual_cumulative_drug_dose' or the 'prescribed_cumulative_drug_dose' field must be submitted.

fields.name: actual_cumulative_drug_dose
fields.description: Indicate the total actual cumulative drug dose in the same units specified in immunotherapy_drug_dose_units.

meta.notes: Either the 'actual_cumulative_drug_dose' or the 'prescribed_cumulative_drug_dose' field must be submitted.

schemas.name: surgery
schemas.description: The collection of data elements related to a donor's surgical treatment at a specific point in the clinical record. To submit multiple surgeries, submit multiple rows in the Surgery file. If a specimen was resected during surgery, indicate the unique identifier of the specimen in the 'submitter_specimen_id' field. If multiple specimens were resected during a single surgical procedure, submit each 'submitter_specimen_id' as a new row with the same 'submitter_treatment_id' and 'surgery_type' values.

fields.name: program_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the ARGO program.

fields.name: submitter_donor_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the donor, assigned by the data provider.

fields.name: submitter_specimen_id
fields.description: If a specimen was resected during surgery, indicate the unique identifier of the specimen here. This submitter_specimen_id should exist in the Specimen file.

meta.notes: Please refer to documentation for instructions on how to submit a specimen that was resected during surgery: https://docs.icgc-argo.org/docs/submission/submitting-clinical-data#submitting-data-in-surgery-file

fields.name: submitter_treatment_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the treatment, assigned by the data provider.

fields.name: surgery_type
fields.description: Indicate the type of surgical procedure that was performed. (References: SNOMED, NCIt, UMLS)

codeList: Debridement of pancreatic and peripancreatic necrosis

fields.name: surgery_site
fields.description: Indicate the ICD-O-3 topography code for the anatomic site where the surgical procedure was performed, according to the International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, 3rd Edition (WHO ICD-O-3).

meta.notes: Refer to the ICD-O-3 manual for guidelines at https://apps.who.int/iris/handle/10665/42344. This field is not required if a specimen was resected during surgery (ie. if `submitter_specimen_id` is submitted) since anatomic site is collected in the Specimen table.

fields.name: surgery_location
fields.description: Indicate whether the surgical procedure was done at the primary, local recurrence or metastatic location.

meta.notes: This field is not required if a specimen was resected during surgery (ie. if `submitter_specimen_id` is submitted) since type of specimen is collected in the Specimen table.

fields.name: tumour_length
fields.description: Indicate the length of the tumour, in millimetres (mm).

fields.name: tumour_width
fields.description: Indicate the width of the tumour, in millimetres (mm).

fields.name: greatest_dimension_tumour
fields.description: Indicate the greatest dimension or diameter of the tumour, in millimetres (mm). (Reference: NCIt C157135)

fields.name: tumour_focality
fields.description: Indicate the characterization of the location of the tumour. (Reference: NCIt: C157425)

fields.name: residual_tumour_classification
fields.description: Indicate the absence or presence of residual tumour after treatment. In some cases treated with surgery and/or with neoadjuvant therapy there will be residual tumour at the primary site after treatment because of incomplete resection or local and regional disease that extends beyond the limit of ability of resection. (Reference: AJCC 8th ed.)

meta.notes: RX (Presence of residual tumour cannot be assessed), R0 (no residual tumour), R1 (microscopic residual tumour), R2 (macroscopic residual tumour)

fields.name: margin_types_involved
fields.description: Indicate the margin type(s) involved.

meta.notes: To include multiple values, separate values with a pipe delimiter '|' within your file.

fields.name: margin_types_not_involved
fields.description: Indicate the margin type(s) not involved.

meta.notes: To include multiple values, separate values with a pipe delimiter '|' within your file.

fields.name: margin_types_not_assessed
fields.description: Indicate the margin type(s) that cannot be assessed.

meta.notes: To include multiple values, separate values with a pipe delimiter '|' within your file.

fields.name: lymphovascular_invasion
fields.description: Indicate the absence or presence of lymphovascular invasion (LVI). LVI includes lymphatic invasion, vascular invasion and lymphovascular invasion. (Reference: AJCC 8th ed.)

codeList: Both lymphatic and small vessel and venous (large vessel) invasion
Lymphatic and small vessel invasion only

fields.name: perineural_invasion
fields.description: A morphologic finding referring to a tumour that has spread along and infiltrated nerve fibers. Indicate the presence or absence of perineural invasion. (Reference: NCIt: C48260, ICCR)

fields.name: extrathyroidal_extension
fields.description: Indicate the involvement of perithyroidal soft tissues by direct extension from the thyroid primary. (Reference: AJCC 8th Ed.)

schemas.name: follow_up
schemas.description: The collection of data elements related to a specific follow-up visit to a donor. A follow-up is defined as any point of contact with a patient after primary diagnosis. To submit multiple follow-ups for a single donor, please submit multiple rows in the follow-up file for this donor.

fields.name: program_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the ARGO program.
Unique identifier of the donor, assigned by the data provider.
fields.name: submitter_donor_id

fields.description: Unique identifier for a follow-up event in a donor's clinical record, assigned by the data provider.
fields.name: submitter_follow_up_id

fields.description: Interval from the primary diagnosis date to the follow-up date, in days.
fields.name: interval_of_followup

meta.notes: The associated primary diagnosis is used as the reference point for this interval. To calculate this, find the number of days since the date of primary diagnosis.

fields.description: Indicate the donor's disease status at time of follow-up. (Reference: RECIST)
fields.name: disease_status_at_followup
submitter_primary_diagnosis_id
fields.description: Indicate if the follow-up is related to a specific primary diagnosis event in the clinical timeline.

fields.name: submitter_treatment_id
fields.description: Indicate if the follow-up is related to a specific treatment event in the clinical timeline.
Indicate the donor's weight, in kilograms (kg), at the time of follow-up.
fields.name: weight_at_followup

fields.description: Indicate the donor's relapse type.
fields.name: relapse_type

meta.notes: This field is required to be submitted if disease_status_at_followup indicates a state of progression, relapse, or recurrence.

fields.description: If the donor was clinically disease free following primary treatment and then relapse or recurrence or progression (for liquid tumours) occurred afterwards, then this field will indicate the length of disease free interval, in days.
fields.name: relapse_interval

meta.notes: This field is required to be submitted if disease_status_at_followup indicates a state of progression, relapse, or recurrence.

fields.description: Indicate the method(s) used to confirm the donor's progression or relapse or recurrence disease status. (Reference: caDSR CDE ID 6161031)
fields.name: method_of_progression_status

codeList: Biomarker in liquid biopsy (e.g. tumour marker in blood or urine)

meta.notes:
This field is required to be submitted if disease_status_at_followup indicates a state of progression, relapse, or recurrence.
To include multiple values, separate values with a pipe delimiter '|' within your file.

fields.description: Indicate the ICD-O-3 topography code for the anatomic site(s) where disease progression, relapse or recurrence occurred, according to the International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, 3rd Edition (WHO ICD-O-3). Refer to the ICD-O-3 manual for guidelines at https://apps.who.int/iris/handle/10665/42344.
fields.name: anatomic_site_progression_or_recurrence

meta.notes:
This field is required to be submitted if disease_status_at_followup indicates a state of progression, relapse, or recurrence.
To include multiple values, separate values with a pipe delimiter '|' within your file.

fields.description: Specify the tumour staging system used to stage the cancer at time of retreatment for recurrence or disease progression. This may be represented as rTNM in the medical report.
fields.name: recurrence_tumour_staging_system

meta.notes: This field is required to be submitted if disease_status_at_followup indicates a state of progression, relapse, or recurrence.

fields.name: recurrence_t_category
fields.description: The code to represent the extent of the primary tumour (T) based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined at the time of retreatment for a recurrence or disease progression, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

meta.notes: This field is required only if the selected recurrence_tumour_staging_system is any edition of the AJCC cancer staging system.

fields.name: recurrence_n_category
fields.description: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined by the extent of the regional lymph node (N) involvement for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined at the time of retreatment for a recurrence or disease progression, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

meta.notes: This field is required only if the selected recurrence_tumour_staging_system is any edition of the AJCC cancer staging system.

fields.name: recurrence_m_category
fields.description: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined by the extent of the distant metastasis (M) for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined at the time of retreatment for a recurrence or disease progression, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

meta.notes: This field is required only if the selected recurrence_tumour_staging_system is any edition of the AJCC cancer staging system.

fields.name: recurrence_stage_group
fields.description: The code to represent the stage group of the tumour, as assigned by the reporting recurrence_tumour_staging_system, that indicates the overall prognostic tumour stage (ie. Stage I, Stage II, Stage III etc.) at the time of retreatment for a recurrence or disease progression.

meta.notes:
This field is dependent on the selected recurrence_tumour_staging_system.
Please refer to the documentation for Tumour Staging Classifications: http://docs.icgc-argo.org/docs/submission/dictionary-overview#tumour-staging-classifications

fields.description: Specify the tumour staging system used to stage the cancer after treatment for patients receiving systemic and/or radiation therapy alone or as a component of their initial treatment, or as neoadjuvant therapy before planned surgery. This may be represented as ypTNM or ycTNM in the medical report.
fields.name: posttherapy_tumour_staging_system
posttherapy_t_category
fields.description: The code to represent the extent of the primary tumour (T) based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined after treatment for patients receiving systemic and/or radiation therapy alone or as a component of their initial treatment, or as neoadjuvant therapy before planned surgery, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

meta.notes: This field is required only if the selected posttherapy_tumour_staging_system is any edition of the AJCC cancer staging system.

fields.name: posttherapy_n_category
fields.description: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined by the extent of the regional lymph node (N) involvement for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined determined after treatment for patients receiving systemic and/or radiation therapy alone or as a component of their initial treatment, or as neoadjuvant therapy before planned surgery, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

meta.notes: This field is required only if the selected posttherapy_tumour_staging_system is any edition of the AJCC cancer staging system.

fields.name: posttherapy_m_category
fields.description: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined by the extent of the distant metastasis (M) for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined after treatment for patients receiving systemic and/or radiation therapy alone or as a component of their initial treatment, or as neoadjuvant therapy before planned surgery, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

meta.notes: This field is required only if the selected posttherapy_tumour_staging_system is any edition of the AJCC cancer staging system.

fields.name: posttherapy_stage_group
fields.description: The code to represent the stage group of the tumour, as assigned by the reporting posttherapy_tumour_staging_system, that indicates the overall prognostic tumour stage (ie. Stage I, Stage II, Stage III etc.) after treatment for patients receiving systemic and/or radiation therapy alone or as a component of their initial treatment, or as neoadjuvant therapy before planned surgery.

meta.notes:
This field is dependent on the selected posttherapy_tumour_staging_system.
Please refer to the documentation for Tumour Staging Classifications: http://docs.icgc-argo.org/docs/submission/dictionary-overview#tumour-staging-classifications

schemas.name: exposure
schemas.description: The collection of data elements related to a donor's clinically relevant information not immediately resulting from genetic predispositions.

fields.name: program_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the ARGO program.
Unique identifier of the donor, assigned by the data provider.
fields.name: submitter_donor_id

fields.description: Indicate donor's self-reported smoking status and history. (Reference: caDSR CDE ID 2181650)
fields.name: tobacco_smoking_status

meta.notes: Current smoker: Has smoked 100 cigarettes in their lifetime and who currently smokes. Includes daily smokers and non-daily smokers (also known as occassional smokers). Current reformed smoker for >15 years: A person who currently does not smoke and has been a non-smoker for more than 15 years, but has smoked at least 100 cigarettes in their life. Current reformed smoker for <= 15 years: A person who currently does not smoke and has been a non-smoker for less than 15 years, but has smoked at least 100 cigarettes in their life. Current reformed smoker, duration not specified: A person who currently does not smoke and has been a non-smoker for unspecified time, but has smoked at least 100 cigarettes in their lifetime. Smoking history not documented: Smoking history has not be recorded or is unknown.

codeList: Current reformed smoker, duration not specified
Lifelong non-smoker (<100 cigarettes smoked in lifetime)

fields.description: Indicate the type(s) of tobacco used by donor. (Reference: NCIt CDE C177629)
fields.name: tobacco_type

meta.notes: To include multiple values, separate values with a pipe delimiter '|' within your file.

fields.description: This field applies to cigarettes. Indicate the smoking intensity in Pack Years, where the number of pack years is defined as the number of cigarettes smoked per day times (x) the number of years smoked divided (/) by 20. (Reference: caDSR CDE ID 2955385)
fields.name: pack_years_smoked

fields.description: Indicate if the donor has consumed at least 12 drinks of any alcoholic beverage in their lifetime. (Reference: caDSR CDE ID 2201918)
fields.name: alcohol_history

fields.description: Describe the donor's current level of alcohol use as self-reported by the donor. (Reference: caDSR CDE ID 3457767)
fields.name: alcohol_consumption_category

codeList: Social Drinker (> once a month, < once a week)

fields.description: Indicate the type(s) of alcohol the donor consumes. (Reference: NCIt CDE C173647)
fields.name: alcohol_type

meta.notes: To include multiple values, separate values with a pipe delimiter '|' within your file.

fields.description: Indicate if the donor has ever used opium or other opiates like opium juice, heroin, or Sukhteh regularly (at least weekly over a 6-month period).
fields.name: opiate_use

fields.description: Indicate if the donor regularly drinks tea, coffee, or other hot drinks.
fields.name: hot_drinks_consumption

fields.description: Indicate how frequently the donor eats red meat. Examples of red meat include beef, veal, pork, lamb, mutton, horse, or goat meat.
fields.name: red_meat_frequency

codeList: Most days but not every day

fields.description: Indicate how frequently the patient eats processed meat. Examples of processed meat include hams, salamis, or sausages.
fields.name: processed_meat_frequency

codeList: Most days but not every day

fields.description: Indicate the frequency of soft drink consumption by the donor.
fields.name: soft_drinks_frequency

codeList: Most days but not every day

fields.description: Indicate how many times per week the donor exercises for at least 30 minutes. (Reference: NCIt CDE C25367)
fields.name: exercise_frequency

codeList: Most days but not every day

fields.description: Indicate the intensity of exercise. (Reference: NCIt CDE C25539)
fields.name: exercise_intensity

codeList: Low: No increase in the heart beat, and no perspiration
Moderate: Increase in the heart beat slightly with some light perspiration
Vigorous: Increase in the heart beat substantially with heavy perspiration

schemas.name: family_history
schemas.description: The collection of data elements describing a donor's familial relationships and familial cancer history.

fields.name: program_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the ARGO program.
Unique identifier of the donor, assigned by the data provider.
fields.name: submitter_donor_id

fields.description: Unique identifier of the relative, assigned by the data provider.
fields.name: family_relative_id

meta.notes: This field is required to ensure that family members are identified in unique records.  Ids can be as simple as an incremented numeral to ensure uniqueness.

fields.description: Indicate if donor has any genetic relatives with a history of cancer. (Reference: NCIt C159104, caDSR CDE ID 6161023)
fields.name: relative_with_cancer_history

fields.description: Indicate genetic relationship of the relative to the donor. (Reference: caDSR CDE ID 2179937)
fields.name: relationship_type

fields.description: The self-reported gender of related individual.
fields.name: gender_of_relative

fields.description: The age (in years) when the donor's relative was first diagnosed. (Reference: caDSR CDE ID 5300571)
fields.name: age_of_relative_at_diagnosis
cancer_type_code_of_relative
fields.description: The code to describe the malignant diagnosis of the donor's relative with a history of cancer using the WHO ICD-10 code (https://icd.who.int/browse10/2019/en) classification.
Relative's last known state of living or deceased.
fields.name: relative_vital_status

fields.description: Indicate the cause of the death of the relative.
fields.name: cause_of_death_of_relative

fields.description: Indicate how long, in days, the relative survived from the time they were diagnosed with cancer.
fields.name: relative_survival_time

schemas.name: biomarker
schemas.description: The collection of data elements describing a donor's biomarker tests. A biomarker is a biological molecule found in blood, other body fluids, or tissues that is indicative of the presence of cancer in the body. Each row should include one or more biomarker test(s) associated with a particular clinical event (submitter_specimen_id, submitter_primary_diagnosis_id, submitter_treatment_id or submitter_follow_up_id field). If the biomarker test is not associated with a particular clinical event, then indicate the time interval at which the biomarker test was performed (test_interval field).

fields.name: program_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the ARGO program.
Unique identifier of the donor, assigned by the data provider.
fields.name: submitter_donor_id
submitter_specimen_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the specimen, assigned by the data provider.

meta.notes: Only one of ['submitter_specimen_id', 'submitter_primary_diagnosis_id', 'submitter_treatment_id', 'submitter_follow_up_id'] is required. If the biomarker test is not associated with a specimen or primary diagnosis, treatment or follow up event, then the 'test_interval' field will be required.

fields.name: submitter_primary_diagnosis_id
fields.description: If the biomarker test was done at the time of primary diagnosis, then indicate the associated submitter_primary_diagnosis_id here.

meta.notes: Only one of ['submitter_specimen_id', 'submitter_primary_diagnosis_id', 'submitter_treatment_id', 'submitter_follow_up_id'] is required. If the biomarker test is not associated with a specimen or primary diagnosis, treatment or follow up event, then the 'test_interval' field will be required.

fields.name: submitter_treatment_id
fields.description: If the biomarker test was done at the initiation of a specific treatment regimen, indicate the associated submitter_treatment_id here.

meta.notes: Only one of ['submitter_specimen_id', 'submitter_primary_diagnosis_id', 'submitter_treatment_id', 'submitter_follow_up_id'] is required. If the biomarker test is not associated with a specimen or primary diagnosis, treatment or follow up event, then the 'test_interval' field will be required.

fields.description: If the biomarker test was done during a follow-up event, then indicate the associated submitter_follow_up_id here.
fields.name: submitter_follow_up_id

meta.notes: Only one of ['submitter_specimen_id', 'submitter_primary_diagnosis_id', 'submitter_treatment_id', 'submitter_follow_up_id'] is required. If the biomarker test is not associated with a specimen or primary diagnosis, treatment or follow up event, then the 'test_interval' field will be required.

fields.description: If the biomarker test was not associated with a specific specimen or follow-up, primary diagnosis or treatment event, then indicate the interval of time since primary diagnosis that the biomarker test was performed at, in days.
fields.name: test_interval

meta.notes: This field is required if the biomarker test is not associated with a specimen or primary diagnosis, treatment or follow-up event. The associated primary diagnosis is used as the reference point for this interval. To calculate this, find the number of days since the date of primary diagnosis.

fields.description: Indicate the level of carbohydrate antigen 19-9 (CA19-9). Carbohydrate antigen 19-9 testing is useful to monitor the response to treatment in pancreatic cancer patients. (Reference: LOINC: 24108-3)
fields.name: ca19-9_level

fields.description: Indicate the quantitative measurement of the amount of CRP, an inflammatory marker, in the blood in mg/L. Used for screening and monitoring for inflammatory disease, infections, and for cardiovascular disease risk assessment. (Reference: NCIt C64548, LOINC 30522-7)
fields.name: crp_levels

fields.description: Indicate the level of lactate dehydrogenase (LDH), in IU/L. An increased amount of LDH in the blood may be a sign of tissue damage and some types of cancer. (Reference: NCI)
fields.name: ldh_level

fields.description: Indicate the value for a hematology laboratory test for the absolute number of neutrophil cells present in a sample of peripheral blood from a donor, in cells/uL. The ANC may be used to check for infection, inflammation, leukemia and other conditions. Cancer treatment such as chemotherapy may reduce the ANC. (Reference: caDSR CDE ID: 2180198)
fields.name: anc

fields.description: Indicate the absolute number of lymphocytes (ALC) found in a given volume of blood, as cells/uL. Lymphocytes help fight off infections and an altered cellular immune function has been demonstrated in patients with cancer. (Reference: NCIt: C113237)
fields.name: alc

fields.description: Indicate whether donor is a carrier of a mutation in a BRCA gene. A mutation in this gene is associated with an increased risk of familial breast and ovarian cancer.
fields.name: brca_carrier

fields.description: Indicate the expression of estrogen receptor (ER). (Reference: NAACCR 3827)
fields.name: er_status

fields.description: Indicate the Allred score for estrogen receptor. The Allred score is based on the percentage of cells that stain positive by immunohistochemistry (IHC) for estrogen receptor (ER) and the intensity of that staining. (Reference: NAACCR: 3828, caDSR CDE ID 2725288)
fields.name: er_allred_score
er_percent_positive
fields.description: Indicate a value, in decimals, that represents the percent of cells staining estrogen receptor positive by immunohistochemistry (IHC).
Indicate the expression of human epidermal growth factor receptor-2 (HER2) assessed by immunohistochemistry (IHC). (Reference: AJCC 8th Edition, Chapter 48)
fields.name: her2_ihc_status

meta.notes: Negative: 0 or 1+ staining, Equivocal: 2+ staining, Positive: 3+ staining

fields.description: Indicate the expression of human epidermal growth factor receptor-2 (HER2) assessed by in situ hybridization (ISH). (Reference: NAACCR: 3854)
fields.name: her2_ish_status

fields.description: Indicate the expression of progesterone receptor (PR). (Reference: NAACCR 3915)
fields.name: pr_status

fields.description: Indicate the Allred score for progesterone receptor. The Allred score is based on the percentage of cells that stain positive by IHC for the progesterone receptor (PR) and the intensity of that staining. (Reference: NAACCR 3916)
fields.name: pr_allred_score
pr_percent_positive
fields.description: Indicate a value, in decimals, that represents the percent of cells staining progesterone receptor positive by immunohistochemistry (IHC).

Indicate the immunohistochemical test result that refers to the over-expression or lack of expression of programmed death ligand 1 (PD-L1) in a tissue sample of a primary or metastatic malignant neoplasm. (Reference NCIt: C122807)
fields.name: pd-l1_status

fields.description: Indicate the expression of anaplastic lymphoma receptor tyrosine kinase (ALK) as assessed by immunohistochemistry (IHC). Abnormalities of ALK can be present in lung cancers.
fields.name: alk_ihc_status

fields.description: Indicate the intensity of anaplastic lymphoma receptor tyrosine kinase (ALK) as assessed by immunohistochemistry (IHC). Abnormalities of ALK can be present in lung cancers.
fields.name: alk_ihc_intensity

fields.description: Indicate the expression of anaplastic lymphoma receptor tyrosine kinase (ALK) as assessed by fluorescence in situ hybridization (FISH). Abnormalities of ALK can be present in lung cancers.
fields.name: alk_fish_status

fields.description: Indicate the expression of receptor lymphoma kinase (ROS1) as assessed by immunohistochemistry (IHC). Gene fusions involving ROS1 can be present in lung cancers.
fields.name: ros1_ihc_status

fields.description: Indicate the expression of Pan-TRK as assessed by immunohistochemistry (IHC). Pan-TRK IHC screens for neurotrophic tyrosine kinase receptor (NTRK) fusions which have been described in many cancers including lung, thyroid and colorectal cancers.
fields.name: pan-trk_ihc_status

fields.description: Indicate the expression of gene arrangement involving the RET proto-oncogene (RET1) as assessed by fluorescence in situ hybridization (FISH). RET gene rearrangements are associated with several different neoplastic conditions. (Reference: NCIt C46005)
fields.name: ret_fish_status

fields.description: Indicate the expression of Human papillomavirus (HPV) p16 as assessed by immunohistochemistry (IHC).
fields.name: hpv_ihc_status

fields.description: Indicate the expression of Human papillomavirus (HPV) as assessed using a laboratory test in which cells are scraped from the cervix to look for DNA of HPV. (Reference: NCIt C93141)
fields.name: hpv_dna_status

schemas.name: comorbidity
schemas.description: The collection of data elements related to a donor's comorbidities. A donor's comorbidities are any medical conditions (e.g diabetes, prior cancer malignancies) that have existed or may occur during the clinical course of the donor who has the index disease under study. To submit multiple comorbidities for a single donor, submit multiple rows in the comorbidity file for this donor.

fields.name: program_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the ARGO program.

fields.name: submitter_donor_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the donor, assigned by the data provider.

fields.name: prior_malignancy
fields.description: Prior malignancy affecting donor.

fields.name: laterality_of_prior_malignancy
fields.description: If donor has history of prior malignancy, indicate laterality of previous diagnosis. (Reference: caDSR CDE ID 4122391)

fields.name: age_at_comorbidity_diagnosis
fields.description: Indicate the age of comorbidity diagnosis, in years.

fields.name: comorbidity_type_code
fields.description: Indicate the code for the comorbidity using the WHO ICD-10 code classification (https://icd.who.int/browse10/2019/en).

meta.notes: This field is required because it should have a cancer or non-cancer ICD-10 code. This field is marked 'Conditional' because it depends on the value of the `prior_malignancy` field. Both these fields will need to be consistent. If `prior_malignancy` is `Yes`, then an ICD-10 code related to cancer is expected in this field. If `prior_malignancy` is `No`, then an ICD-10 code related to a non-cancer condition is expected in this field.

fields.name: comorbidity_treatment_status
fields.description: Indicate if the patient is being treated for the comorbidity (this includes prior malignancies).

fields.name: comorbidity_treatment
fields.description: Indicate treatment details for the comorbidity (this includes prior malignancies).
